def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    # Shoot the first zombie
    ammo -= 1
    shot += 1
    
    # Check if all zombies have been shot
    if shot == zombies:
        return f"You shot all {zombies} zombies."
    
    # Check if there are no more bullets
    if ammo == 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."
    
    # Move the remaining zombies forward
    distance -= 0.5 * (zombies - shot)
    
    # Check if any zombies have reached you
    if distance <= 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."
    
    # Recursively call the function with updated parameters
    return zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot)

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):

    # Shoot one zombie
    shot += 1
    ammo -= 1

    # Check if all zombies are shot
    if shot == zombies:
        return f"You shot all {zombies} zombies."

    # Check if out of ammo
    if ammo == 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."

    # Move remaining zombies closer
    distance -= 0.5

    # Check if zombies reach 0 distance
    if distance <= 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

    # Recursively call the function
    return zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot)

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    # While there are still zombies and ammo left
    while zombies > 0 and ammo > 0:
        # Shoot one zombie
        zombies -= 1
        # Decrease the distance by 0.5 meters
        distance -= 0.5
        # Increase the shot counter by 1
        shot += 1
    # If all zombies are shot
    if zombies == 0:
        return f"You shot all {shot} zombies."
    # If there are still zombies and no ammo left
    elif zombies > 0 and ammo == 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."
    # If there are no zombies left and ammo is left
    elif zombies == 0 and ammo > 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    # keep shooting zombies until there are no zombies left or no ammo left
    while zombies > 0 and ammo > 0:
        # shoot one zombie
        zombies -= 1
        shot += 1
        ammo -= 1
        # move the remaining zombies forward
        distance -= 0.5
        # check if any zombies have reached the distance
        if distance <= 0:
            return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."
    # check if all zombies have been shot
    if zombies == 0:
        return f"You shot all {shot} zombies."
    # check if ran out of ammo before shooting all zombies
    if ammo == 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    # Calculate the maximum number of zombies that can be shot based on the available ammo
    max_shot = min(zombies, ammo)

    # Calculate the number of remaining zombies after shooting
    remaining_zombies = zombies - max_shot

    # Calculate the distance covered by the remaining zombies after shooting
    remaining_distance = distance - max_shot * 0.5

    # Check if all zombies have been shot
    if remaining_zombies == 0:
        return f"You shot all {zombies} zombies."

    # Check if ammo has run out before shooting all zombies
    if max_shot == ammo:
        return f"You shot {max_shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."

    # Check if zombies have reached 0 distance before shooting all of them
    if remaining_distance <= 0:
        return f"You shot {max_shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

    # Recursive call to continue shooting remaining zombies
    return zombie_shootout(remaining_zombies, remaining_distance, ammo - max_shot, shot + max_shot)

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):

  while ammo > 0 and zombies > 0:

    # Shoot a zombie
    ammo -= 1
    shot += 1
    zombies -= 1

    # Move zombies forward
    distance -= 0.5

    # Check if any zombies reached the player
    if distance <= 0:
      return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

  # Check if all zombies are shot
  if zombies == 0:
    return f"You shot all {shot} zombies."

  # Check if ran out of ammo
  if ammo == 0:
    return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    # Shoot one zombie
    shot += 1
    zombies -= 1

    # Check if all zombies are shot
    if zombies == 0:
        return f"You shot all {shot} zombies."

    # Move zombies closer
    distance -= 0.5

    # Check if distance reached 0
    if distance <= 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

    # Check if out of ammo
    if ammo == 1:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."

    # Reduce ammo count
    ammo -= 1

    # Recursive call
    return zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot)

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    # While there are still zombies and ammo left
    while zombies > 0 and ammo > 0:
        # Shoot one zombie
        zombies -= 1
        # Decrease the distance by 0.5 meters
        distance -= 0.5
        # Increase the shot counter by 1
        shot += 1
    # If all zombies are shot

        return f"You shot all {shot} zombies."

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):

    # Check if all zombies are shot
    if shot == zombies:
        return f"You shot all {zombies} zombies."

    # Check if ammo ran out
    if ammo == 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."

    # Shoot one zombie
    ammo -= 1
    shot += 1

    # Check if zombie reached distance
    if distance <= 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

    # Move remaining zombies
    distance -= 0.5 * (zombies - shot)

    # Recursively call function
    return zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot)

# Testing the function
print(zombie_shootout(7, 15, 8)) # "You shot all 7 zombies."

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    # First, we check if the number of zombies is greater than the number of bullets
    if zombies > ammo:
        # If so, we calculate the number of zombies that can be shot before running out of ammo
        zombies_shot = ammo
        # Then, we calculate the number of remaining zombies after shooting all the available bullets
        remaining_zombies = zombies - ammo
        # Next, we calculate the number of seconds it takes for the remaining zombies to reach the player
        seconds = (distance - ammo) / 0.5
        # If the number of seconds is less than or equal to the number of remaining zombies, the player gets eaten
        if seconds <= remaining_zombies:
            return f"You shot {zombies_shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."
        # Otherwise, the player runs out of ammo before shooting all the zombies
        else:
            return f"You shot {zombies_shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."
    # If the number of zombies is less than or equal to the number of bullets, the player can shoot all the zombies
    else:
        return f"You shot all {zombies} zombies."

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):

    # If there are no zombies, return "You shot all 0 zombies."
    if zombies == 0:
        return f"You shot all {shot} zombies."

    # If there are no bullets left, return "You shot X zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."
    if ammo == 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."

    # Shoot one zombie
    zombies -= 1
    shot += 1

    # Move all remaining zombies forward by 0.5 metres
    distance -= 0.5

    # If any zombie reaches 0 metres, return "You shot X zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."
    if distance <= 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

    # Recursively call the function to shoot the next zombie
    return zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo - 1, shot)

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):

    # Base case: If there are no more zombies or ammo, return the appropriate message
    if zombies == 0:
        return f"You shot all {shot} zombies."
    if ammo == 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."

    # Shoot one zombie and decrement the number of zombies and ammo
    zombies -= 1
    ammo -= 1
    shot += 1

    # Check if any zombies have reached the player
    if distance <= 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

    # Move all remaining zombies 0.5 metres closer
    distance -= 0.5

    # Call the function recursively with the updated values
    return zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot)

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):

    # Check if all zombies are shot
    if shot == zombies:
        return f"You shot all {zombies} zombies."

    # Check if ammo ran out
    if ammo == 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."

    # Shoot one zombie
    ammo -= 1
    shot += 1

    # Check if zombie reached distance
    if distance <= 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

    # Move remaining zombies
    distance -= 0.5 * (zombies - shot)

    # Recursively call function
    return zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot)

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    # shoot one zombie
    shot += 1
    ammo -= 1
    
    # check if all zombies are shot
    if shot == zombies:
        return f"You shot all {zombies} zombies."
    
    # check if no more ammo
    if ammo == 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."
    
    # check if zombie reaches distance 0
    if distance <= 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."
    
    # move remaining zombies forward
    distance -= 0.5
    
    # recursive call
    return zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot)

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    # If there are no more zombies left, return the number of zombies shot
    if zombies == 0:
        return "You shot all " + str(shot) + " zombies."
    
    # If there is no more ammo left, return the number of zombies shot before running out of ammo
    if ammo == 0:
        return "You shot " + str(shot) + " zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."
    
    # Shoot one zombie
    zombies -= 1
    shot += 1
    
    # If the remaining zombies reach you before you run out of ammo, return the number of zombies shot before being overwhelmed
    if distance <= (zombies * 0.5):
        return "You shot " + str(shot) + " zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."
    
    # Update the distance and ammo count
    distance -= 0.5
    ammo -= 1
    
    # Call the function recursively with updated parameters
    return zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot)

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    # First, we check if the number of zombies is greater than the number of bullets
    if zombies > ammo:
        # If so, we calculate the number of zombies that can be shot before running out of ammo
        zombies_shot = ammo
        # Then, we calculate the number of remaining zombies after shooting all the available bullets
        remaining_zombies = zombies - ammo
        # Next, we calculate the number of seconds it takes for the remaining zombies to reach the player
        seconds = remaining_zombies * 2
        # Finally, we check if the remaining zombies can reach the player before being shot again
        if distance <= seconds:
            # If so, the player gets eaten
            return f"You shot {zombies_shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."
        else:
            # If not, the player runs out of ammo before shooting all the zombies
            return f"You shot {zombies_shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."
    else:
        # If the number of zombies is less than or equal to the number of bullets,
        # the player can shoot all the zombies and survive
        return f"You shot all {zombies} zombies."

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):

    # If there are no zombies, return "You shot all 0 zombies."
    if zombies == 0:
        return f"You shot all {shot} zombies."

    # If there are no bullets left, return "You shot X zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."
    if ammo == 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."

    # Shoot one zombie
    zombies -= 1
    shot += 1

    # Move all remaining zombies forward by 0.5 metres
    distance -= 0.5

    # If any zombie reaches 0 metres, return "You shot X zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."
    if distance <= 0:
        return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

    # Recursively call the function to shoot the next zombie
    return zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo - 1, shot)

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):
    # Calculate the maximum number of zombies that can be shot based on the available ammo
    max_shot = min(zombies, ammo)

    # Calculate the number of remaining zombies after shooting
    remaining_zombies = zombies - max_shot

    # Calculate the distance covered by the remaining zombies after shooting
    remaining_distance = distance - max_shot * 0.5

    # Check if all zombies have been shot
    if remaining_zombies == 0:
        return f"You shot all {zombies} zombies."

    # Check if ammo has run out before shooting all zombies
    if max_shot == ammo:
        return f"You shot {max_shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."

    # Check if zombies have reached 0 distance before shooting all of them
    if remaining_distance <= 0:
        return f"You shot {max_shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

    # Recursive call to continue shooting remaining zombies
    return zombie_shootout(remaining_zombies, remaining_distance, ammo - max_shot, shot + max_shot)

def zombie_shootout(zombies, distance, ammo, shot=0):

  while ammo > 0 and zombies > 0:

    # Shoot a zombie
    ammo -= 1
    shot += 1
    zombies -= 1

    # Move zombies forward
    distance -= 0.5

    # Check if any zombies reached the player
    if distance <= 0:
      return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: overwhelmed."

  # Check if all zombies are shot
  if zombies == 0:
    return f"You shot all {shot} zombies."

  # Check if ran out of ammo
  if ammo == 0:
    return f"You shot {shot} zombies before being eaten: ran out of ammo."
